Last sunday my friend Paul married Amy, his girlfriend from high school. They were married by a pastor in Bali. I wrote "wishing you a lifetime of love and happiness" My elder brother wrote "best wishes on this wonderful journey as you build your new lives together" My younger brother wrote "thank you for letting us share in this joyful day! We wish you all the best as you embark on this wonderful union" My sister wrote "congratulations on finding each other. Your greatest adventure has just begun" My cousin wrote "wishing you fulfillment of every dream" Do you believe in horoscope? What zodiac sign are you? To me the personality description at times seems correct but I don't believe in the foretelling. I'm an Aries. Tell me about the disposition and personality traits typical of an Aries. I wanna find out if they're accurate. Are you into meditation as well? Today many people practise zen meditation in pursuit of tranquility and happiness. Paul is a musician. His cousin has a bass clarinet exam the week after and she wants paul to accompany her free of charge. He isn't sure if he'll do it but he doesn't want her to feel like the rug is being pulled out from under her. He said "I don't want to pull the rug out from under her" His cousin practises her pieces eight hours a day in pursuit of gaining a distinction in her graded exam. She's single-minded in her pursuit of her goal. I've never met anyone so ambitious and single-minded. A bassoonist with whom paul is rehearsing is also very single-minded and dedicated in pursuit of studying a degree course at a conservatory. Thry both have something in common which is the single-minded pursuit of their goals. A friend of mine named Judy is planning on starting a television network. She's already fired up and ruthless and dedicated in pursuit of profit. She wants to have one channel dedicated to basketball and another channel dedicated to combat sports. She's devoted to making it the best dedicated sports network in the world. My friend Ed has been having a crush on this girl named Jo for eight years. He is still holding out false hope that one day he'll become her boyfriend but Jo has a boyfriend. Hes just being a doormat. During their trip to thailand he bought lots of presents and keepsakes for jo and paid for all of her meals but at the end he ran out of money so he had to ask Jo to lend him some money who's now saying that ed is stating close to her to take advantage of her and her money. They stayed in a twin room which has a pair of twin beds rather than a double bed. She told ed that whe wouldn't sleep with any guys until she was married which we all know isn't true. Ed knew it wasn't true but didn't kind. She even told him twice that she was a bit attracted to him which gave him false hope. That's why he's still holding out false hope that very soon he'll be her boyfriend. Jo recently demanded that Ed buy her a Gucci limited edition handbag which cost twenty seven thousand dollars. Ed bought it but when he realised that she was taking advantage of him again he felt very upset. Another girl named Shirley who he fancied took him to a beauty parlour and sold him facial sessions for over twelve thousand dollars. Ed didn't know he was being taken advantage of until he made his payment on his credit card. As soon as he made his payment Shirley's whole manner changed. Her expression immediately looked different because she had got what she wanted already. She pretended to be cute and said "we can do facials together sweetie" then he got persuaded. Ed has been rejected by so many girls maybe due to the fact that he has no qualifications whatsoever so he ended up being a security guard in a residential building with little career prospects. He fancied my sister so she avoided him. He studied higher diploma in Australia but besides IT he failed all the exams and failed them again in his resits so the government refused to grant him a student visa.

he ended up working as a security guard whose salary is twelve thousand dollars. Recently he said he wanted to take a shot at the CPA exam and become an accountant with better career prospects. It'll improve his job prospects but the best day he said if he failed it it would be a waste of time so he gave up. The problem is he doesn't wanna step out of the comfort zone; he'd rather be an ordinary security guard for the rest of his life. In addition he is extremely skinny. He's 180 centimetres tall but weighs less than 110 pounds. I suggest gaining weight but he didn't listen. I tried to encourage him but to no effect. Jo and Shirley must have swept him off his feet many years ago. Ed is invited to a marathon next month but he may be out of condition for it. Ed's grandfather was granted asylum by the japanese government in the first world war. His cousins Tom and Jerry have been accused of robbery. If convicted they would be jailed for one and a half years. The judge granted Tom bail but refused to grant bail to jerry. Tom's parents agreed to post bail for him who's remanded on bail of eighty thousand dollars whereas jerry is remanded in custody for two weeks. Ed's maid has been stealing his jewelry. After an investigation he said "she's been stealing jewelry from me. I'll grant you that" Ed's best friend is coming to hong kong soon so ed will have him over for a few nights. I said "having your best friend around for a few nights is fair enough but you should let your parents know before having him over" My cousin's husband too said "I grant that it's very kind of you to have your best friend over but you should let your family know beforehand"  My friend paul isn't very well-to-do whereas his girlfriend's family is very well-off. Last Wednesday ne gave a party where cheap wines were served. The sofas in his apartment are made of some cheap materials. His television is cheap and nasty. As some of us wanted to watch the news I asked "if I could turn the television on please" He then said "sure. If you would switch to the news" Last month he got some clothes on the cheap from a shop facing possible liquidation. He bought a pair of cheap sneakers that fell apart after a couple months so I bought him a pair of good quality ones. He's too cheap to buy new trainers. He's very mean with the air conditioner too- it's only on for an hour each day then he turns on the fans and opens the windows instead but the air condition was dirt cheap. He holidayed in Macau last month but he's so cheap he didn't even buy is postcards. He stayed in a three star hotel where it serves cheap and cheerful food and sells cheap and cheerful clothes. He's a clarinetist. He explained to us regarding a piece by ravel "this passage should be played lyrically rather than rhythmically. Otherwise it's a bit cheap." I saw lots of his pencil marks on the score such as cantabile, silence, no pause here, clean pedal, just separate, more melodic voicing, remain soft, stay soft, quiet, hear tenor, clearer, articulate, in time, silvery soft, gentler, take time....Regarding teaching he said "i prefer payment in blocks. My student pays monthly or for four lessons at a time. For this month it's ok to pay on a lesson-by-lesson basis since you might wanna see what it's like to have lessons. From next month onwards pay monthly. Students of all standards are welcome. I'm also an accompanist who accompanies singers for luve performances." He asked me to get him some Clementi scores as I can get them on the cheap from a friend of mine. We watched a kickboxing fight in which Paul hit joe with a chest shot after he lost to joe. We watched a comedy show as well which was full of cheap laughs. The comedian is famous for his vulgar manner and wearing a vulgar suit. His granddad was a cheap gangster and liar. His jokes and jibes were cheap and vulgar.

My friend Paul is a Taurus whereas his girlfriend is an Aquarius. Paul had a meeting yesterday. The meeting was delayed for three hours so tempers flared up and harsh words were exchanged. Violence flared as they scuffled. Several people who dressed in flared jeans were injured in scuffles with the security guards. Even some of the security guards were injured as fighting flared up. One of the people in the meeting went back home before it started as he had an evening barbecue at his home. Some of his friends spilt too much oil when they were barbecuing some steaks causing the barbecue to flare up. There was a sudden flare as his friends barbecued some chicken. As time passed the sky was getting darker so they began to light candles. Some of the candles flared then flickered. Others flickered then went out. Tom let off the fireworks. His cousin too helped to set off the fireworks. Everybody else stood there admired the flares of the fireworks. After three hours, the meeting finally began. Conflict flared during the meeting which at one point threatened to flare into a lawsuit. Half an hour later the conflict quieted down but trouble began to flare in several other districts simultaneously. Tom's cousin Amy has lots of clothes in her wardrobe such as a formal dress that flares out into a train, a pair of flares that flares at the ankle, a skirt that flares just above the knee, a pair of chinos that flares just above the ankle and a skirt with a flare. Tom has a horse at his house. When He is late to feed his horse, it'll flare its nostrils in anger. Then Tom's nostrils will flare back to communicate with it. Haha. Tom has a breezy smile and a breezy personality. An easy-going type of person. I like his breezy manner.
